intro: Perezia aracencis, commonly known as the Aracèn Iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers with a distinctive white center. The plant features grass-like basal leaves and produces tall, slender stems that bear its showy blooms. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
